div.style: color: #222222; font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: start
color: #222222; font-size: small; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; text-align: start

li.span: Meals are free to children 18 and under.
Adult meals are $5.00 (available at buildings only); exact change required.
See locations below. (Note we are no longer distributing meals at Pierce Middle School)

The “Grab and Go” School Lunch Program continues through April 13th – Individual bags containing both breakfast and lunch items will be available for your child(ren) each day, Monday-Friday, to pick up at a school or bus stop near your home. Please see the schedule below for locations and times. The buses will make every effort to be on time at the distribution locations. Please be patient with us as we work out the details of the runs.

Some of the items in the Grab and Go bags require refrigeration and some of the food will need reheating. All of the food that requires cooking has been precooked. For your child(ren)’s safety, please be sure to refrigerate the precooked items if your child does not immediately eat them.

strong.span: Grab and Go at schools and the Community Center will take place at the following locations 9:00-10:30 a.m., Monday-Friday:

div.p: Thurston High School, 26255 Schoolcraft – Door #1 (main entrance)

strong.span: Pierce Middle School, 25605 Orangelawn - front entrance

div.p: Addams Elementary School, 14025 Berwyn – Gym Door
Fisher Elementary School, 10000 Crosley – Gym Door
Jefferson Elementary School, 26555 Westfield – bus in parking lot, 9:30 am - 10:00 am
Vandenberg Elementary School, 24901 Cathedral – Front Door (beginning April 3rd - bus in parking lot, 10:00 am - 10:30 am)

strong.span: Grab and Go at neighborhood bus stops will take place Monday-Friday at the following locations and times:

em.strong: What should my child be doing during this time in terms of academics?

div.p: While South Redford Public Schools are closed following Governor Whitmer’s announcement, there are many opportunities for students to continue their learning at home. South Redford School District is providing resources for students to exercise their minds and stay sharp while they are out of school. These resources are NOT required for students and participation will not impact their grades.

br.p: You will find daily schedules/routines, tips for staying healthy, and educational resources tailored to specific grade levels. We have included tools to help you explain to your child(ren) why they cannot return to school or may be prohibited from their normal activities.
Here is the link to elementary and secondary learning resources as well as information about available internet options:

em.strong: What is the plan for families without a computer?

p.span: In order to further support our families, we are providing Chromebooks to those students who do not have an Internet-accessible device.

li.span: If your child needs a Chromebook to access our online Home Learning Hub, please visit the link located on the district website and complete the
Pick up will take place on Friday, April 3, 2020 between 12:00 p.m. - 1:30 p.m.
There will be no access to school buildings and Chromebooks will be distributed using curbside pickup.

ul.li: The Chromebook Request Form can be completed using a cell phone, tablet, or computer.

li.span: If you require more than one Chromebook, they must be picked up at a single location. You can indicate which school you will pick them up from in the Chromebook Request Form.

em.strong: What can my family be doing to manage stress and anxiety?

div.p: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has a list of ways to manage stress and anxiety during the public health crisis. Please take a look at their website and share the information with your friends, and family:

em.strong: What is the plan for Spring Break? What is the plan for meal service during this time?

div.p: Spring Break remains scheduled for April 6-10. Meal service will continue throughout the break.

em.strong: How will I be notified of updates?

div.p: Please regularly check your email and the district website for updates. New information will be coming out periodically as our school district receives updates. If you are not receiving calls or email updates from the District, please send an email with your phone number to Judy.winterholler@southredford.org and your phone and email contact information will be updated so you will receive District email and phone updates.

aside.style: color: #000000; font-size: 1.0416em; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; text-align: start

div.aside: During this challenging time, we are trying to make information as accurate, current, and accessible as possible.

div.style: color: #000000; font-family: Lato, sans-serif; text-align: start
div.div: South Redford School District can now send updates directly to your mobile device.
Follow these instructions to get information sent directly to your phone:
When prompted, search for "South Redford Schools."
Also, check out our COVID-19 School Closure FAQ Page.
